Articles.Content:
I just came up with a new idea, based on the addition of the real-life SLS parts implemented in .23.5. I propose, for discussion, a new series of stock parts based on the old American and Soviet space programs, like Soyuz parts and Titan II/Saturn IB and V parts.

Now, I'm not saying that the devs will ever do something like this, but wouldn't you agree that this would be an interesting step to go in? We have the SLS, but I think we should also have the giants upon whose shoulders the new parts are based off of.
This apparently still works quite well for .23.5, most parts packs do

I think this should be in the realm of mods/expansion packs. Not everyone cares about flying historical rockets, and I'm not sure how well the parts could be made to work with the current stock parts.

SLS is kind of a special case, as it is part of what I would consider a mandatory expansion pack.

If you like historical rockets, you owe it to yourself to try some of the mods out there, some of them are true labors of love that are fantastic looking and functional.
FASA has a huge selection of parts for Redstone, Atlas, Titan and Saturn rockets. All of them are compatible with the stock and SLS parts.
